page.title: 09GWAITHLA FARM GLADESTRY
page.content: Our farm is called 'Gwaithla'. It is about 330 acres. It was once five separate farms. These farms were called Gwaithla, Cefn-hir, Lower Cwmeinon, Lower Gwaithla, and Derw. Some of the buildings are old and some are new. On the whole farm there are thirteen barns.They are used for storing hay and keeping animals in. The buildings are not all in the same place. At the Derw we have a big new shed where the hay and straw is kept. In the old buildings at the Derw we do shearing and dipping. The sileage clamp is there as well. There is nothing left of Cwmeinon. We let Cefn-Hir house for holidays. The stock that we have is sheep and cattle.Up at Cefn-Hir the ground is a steepish, but down at Gwaithla it is fairly level. We also have rights to keep sheep on Caety Traelow, the hill behind us.
